At the budget that we're looking at and at the price point we're looking at , we should be able to make it work the T_V_ , the V_C_R_ , the stereo set um maybe something else cute like a coffee pot or one other appliance or maybe a lamp .

@highlight

Uh okay , can can I at this point interject um something ?

@highlight

Um we have received instruction from higher up that certain things should not be uh considered .

@highlight

Um the one thing for example something to eliminate maybe that's the teletext , and according to to higher management the it should only control the T_V_ , and the third thing that they wanna make sure um that their that the corporate image is being maintained , and that the corporate colour and design are being used on the product , Um alright now other things that I found out on in my research is that the complaints that people have about the remote controls that are out there now .

@highlight

'Cause a lot of them take too much time to learn how to use , but even more important the thing that we did address in our last meeting that frequently it's lost somewhere in the room .

@highlight

uh we wanna s make it as simple as possible , we wanna make it um obvious and intuitive to use , we talked about the a light emitting thing as well as uh maybe a beep , Okay , so , my personal preferences in this um project are really have to concentrate on the sizzle .

@highlight

We have to have as few buttons as possible , because more buttons is more confusion , So we've gotta concentrate on the features that help you find it , Um and then maybe a motto , like we put fashion in electronics might be something we can use in our marketing campaign .

@highlight

Uh so today I'm going to talk about the working design of the remote controller .

@highlight

in a remote controller you have a chip integrated circuit which is like a brain of the remote controller .

@highlight

It takes the power from a battery and it takes the input and it it transforms into a infro infrared bits and it sends it into the device , like a T_V_ or a air conditioner , something like that so .

@highlight

and uh so uh I think it's hard to design a remote controller for multiple uh devices .

@highlight

Yeah well that's already been eliminated by management , so we're off the hook .

@highlight

So uh user interface controls the chip and accordingly the messages it's like el the text or buttons which uh which are there on the uh remote controller they those we can make uh um like fluorescent if suppose a child is playing with the remote controller and a and she she or he is pressing the buttons all at the time then there should be a beep saying that it's this this is not a a you know a a action , there can be no action taking to that so .

@highlight

like uh uh you should be able to lock your remote controller so that uh um whatever buttons are pressed by a child they can't be like y you i you if you have ki kids and all then they'll be pl playing with the remote controllers so can lock the remote controller .

@highlight

And uh different shapes that we can do like uh we can have you know a all animals shapes or you know comfortable uh whi which can fit into your hands you you say that won't add too much to the budget ?

@highlight

No no no , it won't uh I don't think it will be like , Do you think there's any chance of um having ser in having basically the same machine with the same buttons but maybe several different shapes ?

@highlight

Because we had something sort of sexy for adults and we could have something sort of Silly for children .

@highlight

so I think uh we need to make some buttons which are which are like um uh f in uh in intended for two or three operations , And and the butto buttons also I think if you want to have more features in your remote controller then there should be more buttons .

@highlight

because I think there's a lot of argument to be made for one button for one feature .

@highlight

So um maybe having buttons be various shapes might be a help too .

@highlight

You know , like the a triangle is for the volume and a square is for changing channels , so that people can uh develop a tactile sense of it .

@highlight

And uh display clock i if you want more features then we can display a clock And uh uh of course there should be a case where we can keep all the things As uh User Interface Designer I did a little research to find out what are the features which a user would like to have on their remote .

@highlight

uh something like a radio wave or a infrared light or a LED which can be used to change the different functionalities in the television Now there should be some timer to set for viewing a particular a particular programme or switching on and off a uh a particular programme according to the user choice .

@highlight

and then there should be a child lock system if a particular channel is not to be viewed by a particular uh for a certain age , then the parents can lock that particular channel so that the ch children cannot view that channel .

@highlight

one of the feature a user would like to have is the compactness of the co remote .

@highlight

and it should ha it should have as many buttons as possible for controlling different functionalities of the T_V_ television .

@highlight

And it should have an uh it can have an alarm clock and then to save electricity uh there should not be uh much s move uh lots of circuits and all that .

@highlight

And um uh as uh uh this is my personal preference that it should be in the shape of a T_ in alphabet for more compactability .

@highlight

However uh the decision we have to take in this meeting is who is our target group .

@highlight

And uh what function , working design , how how does it work .

@highlight

Now , talking about the target group which is in a sense everybody , but I think within the target group we have subgroups .

@highlight

we have earlier it was mentioned about um for example elderly people who have limited function with their fingers and hands , And uh I don't know how much we want to cater to children's use .

@highlight

and um I dunno what you feel about whether we can just say we have one target group and for this one target group we're gonna design this one thing So if you've designed something that's very attractive to children um the mummy please mummy please um you know we want it now we wanna go to the store and see it um that has uh a lot of marketing pull .

@highlight

I think the children issue can be addressed with the shape and with colours .

@highlight

The question is only whether our budget will allow to have more than one design in a sense .

@highlight

but uh the target group as a whole is is basically everybody with a T_V_ .

@highlight

can we is it even feasible to make one one remote control with something for everyone , or would we have to use the same electronics and make three different shapes ?

@highlight

They have like removable plastic cases , so you can have a striped one or you can have a fluorescent blue one , or whatever , that in each package you know you have you you have you have for example uh you have let's say a fluorescent blue on it but then you have uh another colour or stripe whatever that already comes in a package .

@highlight

Well we may have to come back to one or two of these points at our next meeting but um If we do some more research , maybe we .

@highlight

If money permits we can address some features for some subgroups within that .

@highlight

Do we agree on on that in principle , like money will tell whether we will be able to do that or not .

@highlight

So now I understand it's lunch break .

@highlight

I I think to sum it up the target group is basically everybody .
summary: The meeting begins and the marketing expert starts her presentation promptly, telling them that her research shows they need a focus- it is not possible to make a device that works on the whole house. The project manager steps in and informs them that they have instructions to eliminate the teletext idea because it is too complicated, and also said they must maintain the corporate image by using corporate designs and colors. The marketing expert resumes, talking about how remotes often get lost and that a light emitter might be useful. The industrial designer gives her presentation, talking about components, materials, and energy sources. They discuss giving the control different shapes to suit both adults and children, making the buttons various shapes, and putting a display clock on the control. The interface designer presents, talking about the features users like on a remote and suggesting that they make the remote a T-shape and add an alarm clock function. They discuss their target group and the possibility of removable plastic cases. They close the meeting deciding to do more research on the plastic cases.
decisions: They cannot make a device that works on the whole house- will need a focus. They will eliminate teletext. They will maintain the corporate image by using the proper designs and colors. Their target group is basically everybody who owns a TV.
problems: They are concerned about making the control marketable to a wide range of age groups, and have discussed making removable plastic covers so that the look is changeable. However, they need to do more research on this topic. They do not know if their budget will allow them to include all the features they would like to such as a light emitter, clock, alarm clock, and child lock.

1: Specification of Components

Case 
      a.Plastic
      b. Strong
      c. no harmful materials
      d. recyclable
	  e. Use of coloring compounds

Integrated Circuit (labeled "TA11835)
      a. Highly sophisticated
      b. resistant to hign as well as low temperatures
      c. with timer and alarm facility
      Resistor
Capacitor
2: Specification of Components

Diode
Transistor
Resonator
Battery
     a. Rechargeable
 Circuit board
3:
You press a button
When you do that you complete a specific connection. 
The chip senses that connection and knows what button you pressed. 
It produces a morse-code-line signal specific to that button. 
The transistors amplify the signal and send them to the LED, which translates the signal into infrared light.
 The sensor in the TV can see the infrared light and "seeing" the signal reacts appropriately
9:
a push button requires a simple chip, but a scroll wheel requires minimally a regular chip, which is in a higher price range. 

As energy source we offer a basic battery or, more ingenious, a hand dynamo (such as in 50 years old torches), a kinetic provision of energy (such as some modern watches that you shake casually to provide energy), or use of solar cells.

Our products can be delivered in different cases. The general case is uncurved (flat). A more original case is single curved or even double curved.
10:
case material supplements, such as plastic, rubber (such as used in anti-RSI stress balls), wood, and titanium (which we also use in our production of space designs). Unfortunately, we can't use the titanium for the double curved cases and latex cases won't allow the use of solar cells as energy source. 
For the electronics, we can use a simple, a regular or an advanced chip on print. The chip on print includes an infrared sender. Furthermore we just developed a sample sensor/ sample speaker.

0:
Presented by: Jahnavi, Industrial Designer
And 
Francina User Interface designer.
1: Look and feel

We have made a model which looks like a snail and made up of clay.
Case
     a. form: snail
     b. Material: Plastic
     c. Color: Blue.
Interface Elements:
      a. Function: 
           i. Switch On/Off button placed on the top, material used is soft rubber, form is round, color is red.
           ii. LED: front, florouscent green, bulb, oval.
           iii. Mute: white, side, round, soft rubber.
           iv. Channel Buttons: round, yellow, soft rubber, both sides.
           v. Next/Previous channel buttons & Voice control buttons: Orange, round, Soft rubber.
           vi. Menu button: Green, round, soft rubber.
Case holder could be in shell shape.
Method

An energy source(say battery) feeds an integrated circuit (chip) that can compose messages, often in the form of infrared bits. 
A user interface controls the chip, and accordingly the messages.

The text/ buttons which can be seen even if it is dark (like flouroscent)

5: Stores Up to 80 speech samples, Controls 4 Devices -TV, Cable/Satellite, VCR/DVD & Audio. Record your own verbal labels that is connected to a remote control function : voice recognition
7: This jumbo universal remote control is almost impossible to misplace or lose.
8: Speech recognicer which will respond to voice.

doc.content:
[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your roles perspective.



The introductions were brief and everyone stated their function.















	

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	It was decided to design a new remote control which would have multi-functions, i.e. turn on not only the TV, but other household gadgets. The design should also be compact and modern. A further point was raised as to finding mislaid controls, i.e. light sensor which would activate a signal.

	

	

	

	

	

	

	

	

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	No problems arose.

	

	

	

	

	

	

	

	

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.

Each member will follow their instructions.

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your roles perspective.



Notechnical function design and the working design. In summary I can say that we all agree that the new remote control should be easy to use with user friendly features like special buttons, children locks and the product should be stylish.













	

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

It was decided that the target group is everybody who owns a TV. As directed by management the function will be limited to TV use and the company identity will be clearly retained on the product. Budget permitting cosmetic differences are desirable for different groups of people, e.g. elderly people who have trouble pushing a very tiny button. Fashionable covers for the remote control are desirable, like different shapes and colours.

	

	

	

	

	

	

	

	

	

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.
No major problems in the meeting.


	

	

	

	

	

	

	

	

	

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.

Each participant will develop the details discussed.

Dear Colleague,







[ABSTRACT] Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your roles perspective.



The User Interface designer made her presentation. The remote should have 9 buttons for channel selection, as well as a volume button, button to activate subtitles etc. The design should be child friendly, e.g. few buttons, colourful, star-shaped buttons etc. She showed various possible remotes as to shape and colour including an oversized model. Her personal preference is speech recognition.

The industrial designer suggested a special case made out of plastic that is strong and without using harmful materials. She feels it should be recyclable. She would like to use colours for this remote.

An Integrated circuit board that is highly sophisticated and temperature resistant are among her suggestions. In addition, the remote should include a timer and alarm, resistor and capacitor (battery).



The marketing expert mentioned her methods of information gathering, e.g. checking out the competition, doing research on the internet and through personal observations. Her findings showed that the item should be small, easy to use and eye catching. One of the most important factors from the ME point of view is to get to market before the competition. Develop one or two special features on which we can base our marketing campaign  too many special features creates confusion.



















[DECISIONS] Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



The remote should be battery operated with a chip. Trendy design, compact and strong. Buttons should be used. Special feature  speech recognition. 

















[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



No problems arose.

















[ACTIONS] Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.



Each participant will develop their task, The UID and the ID will work together to come up with a prototype of this new remote.

ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your roles perspective.



















	

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

design a remote control

	a* with min.production cost about 12.50 euros7item.

	Should be compact

	Should have some mechanism by which one can find if it is lost are misplaced.

	

	

	

	

	

	

	

	

	

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	

	

	 the compactness.

	make the remote controller functionable for different things like TV, air conditioning, music player etc.

	

	

	

	

	

	

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.

Work on technical functional design and specify user interface 

And working design

ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your roles perspective.



In the meeting several marketing design and user interface issues were discussed. The marketing manager has talked about the attracting people, releasing the product by Christmas, and cost. The Industrial Designer talked about the working model, components required and features can be added. The user Interface person talked about the features which peoplr may want also some good points like child lock facility.









	

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

The remote controller will be usable only for TV. A single model will be released to meet the requirements of people of all kinds and age groups.

	

	

	

	

	

	

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

How big the buttons should be.

	How to control the cost.

	How to make attractive to everybody.

	What new features can be included.

	

	

	

	

	

	

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.



Have lunch and chat for sometime.

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your roles perspective.

In the meeting the User Interface designer showed many possible models and their advantages and disadvantages. She has also proposed speech recognition feature in the remote controller which is interesting. The industrial designer talked about the technical stuff and components used in the remote controller as well as how it works.

The marketing person has discussed various surveys she has done and told that compat and simple is beautiful.



	

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

User Friendly 

	colourful

	compact

	use battery for power supply

	

	

	

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

Speech recognition facility in the remote controller.

	How to make it more attractive.

	Cost effective

	

	

	

	

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.

Make the model of remote controller with the clay provided.

Fill up the questionnaires.

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your roles perspective.



The prototype is presented. The remote controller is blue in color with buttons yellow, green, and orange colors. The shape in like a snail. Very compact. Marketing wise its sellable, and possesses nice functionalities. The cost is less and room for more features. Finally, its been decided that the project is successfully done with team work, and research.

The product will be further evaluated for the inclusion of speech recognition feature and the final cost will be evaluated.







	

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.


	*The shape of the product.

	*The color of the product.

	*marketing strategy.

	*Cost 


	

	

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

Functionality.

	*Marketing

	*Speech recognition.

	

	

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.



Take rest

This was followed by ideas from  each participant on the  design cost effective and useful ness , which concluded with a brief discussion.the interface design was discussed.

	1.we all agreed that the remote we design should  have multi purpose role.
